entry.def: If resources or efforts are misdirected, they are used in the wrong way or for the wrong purposes.

example.ex: Many of the aid projects in the developing world have been misdirected in the past.
example.tran: 过去，许多对发展中国家的援助计划没有得到合理实施。

entry.tran: 将…引错方向;给…指错方向
entry.def: If you misdirect someone, you send them in the wrong direction.

example.ex: He had deliberately misdirected the reporters.
example.tran: 他故意给记者们指错方向。

means.word_mean: 1. corrupt morally or by intemperance or sensuality;

sentences.sentence: "debauch the young people with wine and women"
"Socrates was accused of corrupting young men"

means.word_mean: 2. lead someone in the wrong direction or give someone wrong directions;

sentences.en: I wanted to go to the station, but I was misdirected.
